intro: Aiouea talamancensis, commonly known as the Talamancan aiouea, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with a smooth surface. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
